body.p: In October 1997, IASC, together with the Accounting Standards Boards in Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and the United States, published a discussion paper entitled International Review of Accounting Standards Specifying a Recoverable Amount Test for Long‑Lived Assets (Jim Paul, from the staff of the Australian Accounting Research Foundation, was the principal author). This discussion paper resulted from the discussions of a ‘working group’ consisting of some Board members and senior staff members from the standard‑setting bodies listed above and IASC. The paper:

li.p: noted the key features of the working group members’ existing or proposed accounting standards that require an impairment test, and compared those standards; and
proposed the views of the working group on the major issues.
